summary: The European School of Administration (ESA) is an institution established to enhance the professional development and training of civil servants within the European Union. It aims to foster a cohesive European civil service by providing high-quality educational programs that emphasize the principles of EU law, governance, and regulatory frameworks. The ESA plays a crucial role in ensuring that EU officials are well-versed in the complexities of EU institutions and their functions. By promoting a shared understanding of European policies and practices, the ESA contributes to the effective implementation of EU legislation and the overall efficiency of the European administrative landscape.
